results.title: Dressed for the part
results.creator_credit: Shell Film Unit and Ronald Gardner
results.brief_description: The increasingly important role of safety committees in watching for sources of danger to the worker and seeing that adequate protection is provided. Types of protective clothing for acid handling, welding, lathe work, drum handling and working at heights are shown in use. The film ends with a reminder that while safety committees are doing a good job, their work is ineffective unless the equipment they provide is used by those for whom it was designed.

results.title: Dreams and silence = Reves et silences
results.creator_credit: Sourat Films, FR3, CBA and Omar Al-Qattan
results.brief_description: It is the autumn of 1990 in Jordan. The Islamic movement has declared a Holy War against the West and the Gulf War is at its height. Haifa Samhouri is a middle-aged Palestinian refugee living in Jordan. In this sensitively produced and directed documentary, Haifa talks of her life as a refugee, her love for her homeland, her arranged and loveless marriage, her sons, and her continuing philosophical battle with her religion, Islam, which on the one hand offers salvation and on the other, oppression, especially towards women. Bitter at times but often displaying an ironic sense of humour we see Haifa as she goes about her daily life, confronting, questioning her husband and male neighbours about the role of women within the Islamic faith but also prepared to sacrifice her son in the war if it means winning the war. Juxtaposed to Haifa’s story, is a discourse by an Islamic spiritual leader on the political and philosophical aspects of Islam against the background of the suffering and destruction of the Arab world and the aftermath of the Gulf War. Winner of several awards including Joris Ivens Award (1st prize) International Documentary Film Festival, Amsterdam 1991 and Honorary prize, Best Documentary, Valencia Film Festival, 1991. In Arabic with English and French subtitles.

results.title: Dream time machine time
results.creator_credit: Don Featherstone Productions and Don Featherstone
results.brief_description: The work of four Aborigines working in the visual and written arts, are examined. The video dramatises some of Archie Weller’s work and films him and his community in Perth. Also featured are Kath Walker, whose poetry is of international standing, Trevor Nicholls, an urban aboriginal painter in Melbourne and Banduk Marika, who has an intimate knowledge of lore and art. The artists speak for themselves and reveal the relationship between aboriginal art forms and contemporary work.

results.title: Dream of home
results.creator_credit: Michael Eddowes Films and John Fitchen
results.brief_description: A short survey of the life of the well known British poet, Rupert Brooke, who was killed in the first World War. His poems dealt with life, love and above all his love of England. The famous poem “The old vicarage, Grantchester” is spoken and illustrated by views of the countryside, buildings and people of England.

results.title: Dream house
results.creator_credit: John Honey and Tasmanian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Puppets go through the steps of building the Australian “dream house” with disastrous results. The second part of the film examines the many legal pitfalls, and suggestions are made for the wise consumer to follow.

results.title: Dream house
results.creator_credit: Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School and Sally Pryor
results.brief_description: A dream in which the dreamer imagines she can travel into her own brain using computer animation. This brain has a structure like a house, with each room containing images of personality and personal experience.

results.title: Drawings and the shop
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Engineering Drawing”.
Emphasises and describes the relationship between the making of the drawing and the various production operations in shop and factory. The flow of work, as called for in the various drawings of typical metal products, is traced through the pattern shop, the foundry, the forge shop, the machine shop, and the assembly shop. Representative operations in each of these departments is demonstrated.
